findings.title: Vulnerable dependencies in the Substrate parachain
findings.description_summary: The Substrate parachain uses dependencies with known vulnerabilities, including chrono, lru, time, and net2, which may lead to potential segfaults or memory issues.

findings.title: Users can avoid accruing interest by repaying a zero amount
findings.description_summary: Users can avoid paying interest on loans by repaying a zero amount, resetting the borrow index without repaying anything.

findings.title: Missing validation in Pallet::force_update_market
findings.description_summary: The force_update_market method lacks sufficient validation, potentially allowing unintended changes to immutable market parameters.

findings.title: Missing validation in multiple StakingLedger methods
findings.description_summary: StakingLedger methods lack sufficient input validation and unchecked arithmetic, potentially leading to inconsistent states or race conditions.

findings.title: Failed XCM requests left in storage
findings.description_summary: Failed XCM requests are left in storage indefinitely if not handled properly by the notification_received method.

findings.title: Failed XCM requests left in storage
findings.description_summary: The loans pallet may use stale oracle prices, leading to incorrect asset valuations.

findings.title: Missing calculations in crowdloans extrinsics
findings.description_summary: The claim and refund extrinsics do not update the vault's total contribution, leading to incorrect calculations.

findings.title: Event emitted when update_vault and set_vrf calls do not make updates
findings.description_summary: The update_vault and set_vrfs extrinsics emit events even when no actual updates are made.

findings.title: The referral code is a sequence of arbitrary bytes
findings.description_summary: The referral code in the crowdloans pallet is arbitrary and unvalidated, potentially allowing log injection attacks.

findings.title: Missing validation of referral code size
findings.description_summary: The contribute extrinsic lacks validation on the referral code size, potentially leading to memory exhaustion.

findings.title: Code duplication in crowdloans pallet
findings.description_summary: Code duplication in the crowdloans pallet increases the risk of inconsistent patches and complicates maintenance.

findings.title: Need to upgrade the module
findings.description_summary: Memory access vulnerability in Cranelift module due to code generation flaw, fixed by upgrading to >= 0.73.1 or >= 0.74.

findings.title: Numeric overflow
findings.description_summary: Numeric overflow vulnerability due to lack of checked_add/checked_sub, fixed by adding these methods.

findings.title: Lack of bounds checking
findings.description_summary: Lack of bounds checking for mint_amount, recommended to enhance.

findings.title: Oracle price feed risk
findings.description_summary: Oracle price feed may be inaccurate due to lack of a time parameter.

findings.title: Calculate inaccurate risk
findings.description_summary: Inaccurate calculation risk due to potential integer overflow; replace saturating operations with checked operations.

findings.title: User balance is not checked before transfer
findings.description_summary: User balance is not checked before transfer, allowing potential insufficient funds.

findings.title: Return value not checked
findings.description_summary: Return value of unreserve function is not checked, risking unhandled errors.

findings.title: Calculate inaccurate risk
findings.description_summary: Potential inaccurate calculation due to integer overflow; replace saturating operations with checked operations.

findings.title: Missing logic
findings.description_summary: Missing rollback logic for failed transfers in staking payouts.

findings.title: Missing error message
findings.description_summary: Missing error message in delegation handling, leaving potential issues unlogged.

findings.title: ChainExtension Implementation Lacks Weight Charging
findings.description_summary: The ChainExtension implementation does not charge weight for runtime calls, making the system vulnerable to Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks.

findings.title: Vector of unlimited size in the pallet
findings.description_summary: Unrestricted vector size can lead to memory exhaustion and DoS attacks.

findings.title: Employment of Sudo Pallet
findings.description_summary: The use of the sudo pallet risks centralization and security vulnerabilities due to potential misuse of root access.

findings.title: Error Handling in Chain Extension
findings.description_summary: Use of generic DispatchError::Other hampers error handling and troubleshooting.

findings.title: Hardcoded Constants in match
findings.description_summary: Hardcoded constants in match statements reduce code readability and maintainability.

findings.title: Logging in Runtime
findings.description_summary: Excessive warn!() macros in the implementation of ChainExtension clutter code and reduce maintainability.

findings.title: Pendulum build
findings.description_summary: Missing a member in the workspace configuration.

findings.title: Superfluous Implementation of Hooks Trait
findings.description_summary: The Hooks trait has been declared in the orml-currencies-allowance-extension pallet, but no custom implementations have been provided.

findings.title: Vulnerable and Unmaintained Dependencies
findings.description_summary: Dependency includes one vulnerable and three unmaintained crates requiring updates or replacements.

findings.title: TCR voting design should be improved
findings.description_summary: TCR voting design allows self-voting, zero-amount votes, and potential manipulation by large token holders.

findings.title: Denomination logic should be improved
findings.description_summary: Denomination logic bypasses minimum bond check when only one validator is nominated.

findings.title: Emergency shutdown not used in critical functions
findings.description_summary: Emergency shutdown functionality is missing in multiple critical public functions across different pallets.

findings.title: Missing sanity checks
findings.description_summary: Missing sanity checks in set_staking_limits function may allow invalid parameter values.

findings.title: Vesting to yourself is allowed
findings.description_summary: Vesting schedule allows setting up a vesting to oneself without restrictions.

findings.title: Missing zero value check
findings.description_summary: Allocate function lacks a zero-value check for the amount argument.

findings.title: Vesting schedules less than a current block can be created
findings.description_summary: Vesting schedules can be created with start blocks earlier than the current block, making them redundant.

findings.title: Redundant check
findings.description_summary: Redundant check of new_lock.is_zero() found in grants pallet.

findings.title: Redundant variable
findings.description_summary: Redundant variable old1 in on_finalize function.

findings.title: Usage of vulnerable crates
findings.description_summary: Usage of crates with known vulnerabilities identified.

findings.title: Outdated Rust edition
findings.description_summary: Project is using an outdated Rust edition (2018).

findings.title: Integer overflow
findings.description_summary: Integer overflow vulnerability due to unchecked arithmetic operations in ethereum_signable_message and to_ascii_hex functions.

findings.title: Total issuance not updated on mint
findings.description_summary: Total issuance is not updated on mint, causing potential discrepancies in token data.

findings.title: Casting overflow
findings.description_summary: Casting overflow vulnerability due to unchecked type conversion in decode_string method.

findings.title: Slash amount validation missing
findings.description_summary: Missing validation in slash_reserved method allows slashing beyond account balance.

findings.title: Currency ID validation missing
findings.description_summary: Missing validation for currency ID in multiple methods could lead to resource exhaustion.

findings.title: Vector capacity validation missing
findings.description_summary: Missing validation in to_ascii_hex function allows vector capacity to exceed maximum limit.

findings.title: Static fee charged despite dynamic storage accesses
findings.description_summary: Fixed fees are charged for dynamic storage operations, potentially leading to DoS as CandidatePool size grows.

findings.title: Users can use any previously seen Merkle root
findings.description_summary: Allowing any previously seen Merkle root increases the risk of hash collisions, potentially allowing asset theft.

findings.title: MantaPay weights calculated with a small database
findings.description_summary: Inadequate benchmarking of weights for MantaPay's Merkle tree could lead to DoS attacks as the tree grows.

findings.title: Total supply of native assets can exceed the set limit
findings.description_summary: Native asset supply can exceed the maximum limit for an account, causing to_private transactions to fail.

findings.title: Missing updates in update_asset_metadata
findings.description_summary: update_asset_metadata does not apply updates to min_balance and is_sufficient metadata as expected.

findings.title: No slashing mechanism for collators
findings.description_summary: No automated slashing mechanism exists to penalize poorly performing collators, relying on social pressure and manual intervention.

findings.title: Collators given full rewards regardless of quality
findings.description_summary: Collators receive full rewards regardless of block quality, allowing low-quality blocks to earn the same as high-quality ones.

findings.title: Missing validation in pull_ledger_diff
findings.description_summary: Missing bounds checks in pull_ledger_diff could lead to overflow, potentially crashing the node.

findings.title: increase_count_of_associated_assets can overflow
findings.description_summary: increase_count_of_associated_assets lacks overflow check, risking node crash or reset to zero in certain cases.

findings.title: Account checks are incorrect
findings.description_summary: Account checks in transaction validation assume unique accounts, which may lead to issues if APIs change to allow multiple accounts.

findings.title: Unstaked user may be selected as collator
findings.description_summary: Unstaked users may be selected as collators if no sufficiently staked collators are available, reducing network stability.

findings.title: XCM instructions can charge 0 weight
findings.description_summary: XCM instructions can be executed with zero weight, allowing potential spam through 0-cost messages.

findings.title: Missing validation in set_units_per_second
findings.description_summary: Missing validation in set_units_per_second allows potential overflow, enabling weight to be purchased at low cost, risking DoS.

findings.title: Collator is a single point of failure for a round
findings.description_summary: Single collator selection creates a point of failure, risking block production halt if the collator goes down.

findings.title: Unchecked index calculation in spend_all
findings.description_summary: Unchecked index calculation in spend_all may cause overflow, leading to incorrect data insertion.

findings.title: Excess fees not refunded
findings.description_summary: Extrinsics may charge unnecessary fees without refunding excess.

findings.title: Assets can be registered at unsupported locations
findings.description_summary: Assets can be registered without validating their location.

findings.title: Minimum delegator funds is not MinDelegatorStk
findings.description_summary: Delegators can have staked funds below the required MinDelegatorStk.

findings.title: Unintended test crashes
findings.description_summary: Randomized test may fail due to unintended overflow in total supply generation.

findings.title: Loss of Reserved SBT IDs
findings.description_summary: Users lose previously reserved SBT IDs if they reserve new ones without minting the old.

findings.title: Last SBT IDs Cannot Be Reserved
findings.description_summary: Overflow in next_sbt_id_and_increment causes unreserved IDs and transaction failure.

findings.title: Downcasting of 64-Bit Integer
findings.description_summary: Casting usize to smaller types may cause data loss and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Unchecked Math Could Impact Weight Calculation
findings.description_summary: Unchecked math in weight calculations may lead to overflow, underflow, or division by zero errors.

findings.title: SBT reservations can be overwritten
findings.description_summary: SBT reservations can be overwritten, causing users to lose reserved tokens.

findings.title: Extrinsics charge static fees that do not account for Merkle tree updates
findings.description_summary: Static fees for extrinsics do not account for Merkle tree updates, risking underpriced transactions.

findings.title: Missing validation in pull_ledger_diff
findings.description_summary: Missing bounds check in pull_ledger_diff could allow overflow and node crash.

findings.title: Off-by-one error in to_private
findings.description_summary: Off-by-one error in to_private may prevent users from minting reserved tokens.

findings.title: Unnecessary Storage Variable
findings.description_summary: Unnecessary storage variable increases transaction fees and storage usage.

findings.title: Missing validation when setting mint info
findings.description_summary: Missing validation allows minting periods to be set in the past, blocking minting.

findings.title: Missing benchmarking for the lockdrop precompile dispatch
findings.description_summary: Underestimated weight_to_gas estimation due to missing benchmarking allows attackers to perform denial of service attacks.

findings.title: Unbounded call length limit in lockdrop dispatch call
findings.description_summary: Unbounded call length in dispatch call allows attackers to cause heap overflow and perform denial of service attacks.

findings.title: Weight calculation
findings.description_summary: Constant weight for functions, ignores variable data in MetadataSymbol & MetadataName.
